alert.note: Alert for Shasta (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 13 at 6:07PM PDT until further notice by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, in the following county, Shasta. * WHEN...Until 700 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 559 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Thunderstorms may redevelop resulting in more heavy rainfall over the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.7 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Redding, Shasta Dam, Shasta Lake, O`brien, Mountain Gate, and Keswick. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
